Text.Value: Best head inside. There's food and warmth to spare.

EditorData.NodeContext: Concern. You want the player to be safe.

Text.Value: Don't think so, but we don't really know one way or the other. Better safe than sorry, Jaheira'd say.

EditorData.NodeContext: concerned for his charge, hoping the player can help

Text.Value: Why steer clear? Is he dangerous?
Wish the fellow inside could say the same.

EditorData.NodeContext: sigh, he's worried about his charge

Text.Value: He clearly needs help, but we're stretched thin as is. He's just inside, if you want to give him a once-over.

EditorData.NodeContext: concerned for his charge, hoping the player can help

Text.Value: I'll not abandon my post. But it might be a friendly face could rouse the poor fellow.

EditorData.NodeContext: concerned for his charge, hoping the player can help

Text.Value: The Harpers won't let you down.

EditorData.NodeContext: reassuring

Text.Value: Not another ward, I hope? I'm better at subterfuge and spellcasting than babysitting.

EditorData.NodeContext: his delivery is serious but a slight smile betrays that he is joking

Text.Value: Who are you babysitting?
Really? That's a pity.

EditorData.NodeContext: concerned, he was hoping the player could help

Text.Value: It's not the shadows or its curse that scare me - it's seeing Lady Jaheira so worried.

EditorData.InternalNodeContext: Siege is over, but Haven doesn't have any protection anymore.
EditorData.NodeContext: Fearful but doing your best to be strong.

Text.Value: If that were the Harper way, I wouldn't be standing here.

EditorData.NodeContext: serious - player just suggested he hurt someone. He would never do so without cause.

Text.Value: Wouldn't I like to know. I've asked the fellow many times, but he's not in a talking mood.

EditorData.NodeContext: sigh, he's worried about his charge

Text.Value: He's comatose. You should put him out of his misery.
I'm not taking over for you.
I need to focus on the front - hopefully you and our friend inside are getting on well.

EditorData.NodeContext: Mild annoyance

Text.Value: Fellow inside could probably use a bit more attention, but I'm more concerned with shadows at the gate, frankly.

EditorData.NodeContext: sigh, he's worried about his charge

Text.Value: I'd not tarry out here were I you.

EditorData.NodeContext: Concern. You want the player to be safe.

Text.Value: I'd rather face Ketheric's armies than suffer traitors. Watch out for those Flaming Fist.

EditorData.InternalNodeContext: State after repelling the attack of the Flaming Fist traitor. NPCs are afraid of other possible attacks.
EditorData.NodeContext: Fearful. Maudlin.

Text.Value: I pray that when we're done with Ketheric, we'll have time for him.

EditorData.NodeContext: concerned he wishes he could do more to help

Text.Value: I can handle myself, thanks.
Stay silent.
I question who is really on our side. Give me no reason to doubt you.

EditorData.InternalNodeContext: State after repelling the attack of the Flaming Fist traitor. NPCs are afraid of other possible attacks.
EditorData.NodeContext: Fearful. Maudlin.

Text.Value: Be ready for anything at Moonrise - Ketheric won't go down easy.

EditorData.NodeContext: nervous warning

Text.Value: Trot on if you want, or you could see if a friendly face'd do him any good.

EditorData.NodeContext: concerned for his charge, hoping the player can help

Text.Value: I should hope so.
Jaheira warned the others to steer clear, hence why I'm on door duty. You, on the other hand...

EditorData.NodeContext: concerned he wishes he could do more to help

Text.Value: My hands might be trembling, but don't worry - I'll protect this place with my life.

EditorData.InternalNodeContext: Siege is over, but Haven doesn't have any protection anymore.
EditorData.NodeContext: Darkness on all sides. You're doing your best to be strong.

Text.Value: I've tried waking him - to no avail.
Judging by his uniform he's someone of import - he was here, fresh from the shadows, when Isobel banished the curse here.

EditorData.NodeContext: concerned he wishes he could do more to help

Synopsis:
Tumeril is young for a High Elf but passionate about the Harper cause. He is formal, but sincere in his concern for the player, and the fight to free this land from the Darkness. And experienced practioner of magic, he is prepared to lay down his life for the cause if needs be.
This dialogue covers all his main states in the Last Light Inn. His default state is outside the tavern doors, keeping a lookout. He is a backup for the main quest, and will point the player towards the comatose Art Cullagh, who is pivotal to lifting the curse on the shadowlands.
